body.class: mediawiki ltr ns-6 ns-subject page-File_Flag_of_Switzerland_svg skin-vector

img.alt: File:Flag of Switzerland.svg

div.p: Flag_of_Switzerland.svg‎ (SVG file, nominally 1,000 × 1,000 pixels, file size: 281 B)

This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

a.title: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

img.alt: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

p.style: width:30em; border:2px solid #55b05a; margin:1px 0; background:#fff; color:#000;

div.p: W3C ✓ The source code of this SVG is valid

th.style: background: #ccf; text-align: right; vertical-align: top; padding-right: 0.4em; width: 15%

td.div: English: The national flag of Switzerland.
日本語: スイスの国旗。
ไทย: ธงชาติ ประเทศสวิตเซอร์แลนด์
Tiếng Việt: Quốc kỳ Thụy Sỹ.

th.style: background: #ccf; text-align: right; padding-right: 0.4em; white-space: nowrap

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr;

img.alt: Public domain

td.i: This image of simple geometry is ineligible for copyright and therefore in the public domain, because it consists entirely of information that is common property and contains no original authorship.

p.span: Беларуская (тарашкевіца) | Català | Česky | Deutsch | English | Español | Eesti | Euskara | Suomi | Français | Italiano | 日本語 | 한국어 | Македонски | Português | Русский | ไทย | 中文 | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | ‪中文(台灣)‬ | +/−

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction:ltr;

td.span: This image shows a flag, a coat of arms, a seal or some other official insignia. The use of such symbols is restricted in many countries. These restrictions are independent of the copyright status.

span.small: This tag does not indicate the copyright status or the source of the attached work. A normal copyright tag and a source are still required. See Commons:Licensing for more information.

p.span: Alemannisch | Boarisch | Български | Català | Česky | Dansk | Deutsch | Ελληνικά | English | Esperanto | Español | Eesti | Euskara | Suomi | Français | Hrvatski | Magyar | Bahasa Indonesia | Italiano | 日本語 | ქართული | 한국어 | Lietuvių | Македонски | മലയാളം | Plattdüütsch | Nederlands | Polski | Português | Română | Русский | ไทย | Українська | Vèneto | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | ‪中文(简体)‬ | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | 粵語 | +/−

td.style: background: #ccf; text-align: right; padding-right: 0.4em; font-weight: bold

tr.td: File:Flag of Switzerland (Pantone).svg (for the stated Pantone shade of 485)

div.p: Click on a date/time to view the file as it appeared at that time.

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 08:00, 19 June 2010
Thumbnail for version as of 20:26, 23 February 2010

td.span: (Reverted to version as of 20:33, 15 February 2010 (File:Flag of Switzerland (Pantone).svg uploaded, so users can pick))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 05:20, 16 February 2010

td.span: (we don't work for the swiss government / aren't we trying to represent _real_ flags?)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 20:33, 15 February 2010

td.span: (I received another copy of the Swiss Government design manual; they stated for online use, the arms and flag must be #ff0000.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 22:19, 30 November 2009

td.span: (At a conference I went to, I was handed Swiss Army Regulation 51.340 D, about Swiss military flags. A construction sheet was provided and, while we had the cross sizes correct, it was loo large in accordance with the flag size. The cross is 20x20 on a fla)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 21:11, 10 August 2009
Thumbnail for version as of 16:52, 20 April 2009
Thumbnail for version as of 16:45, 20 April 2009
Thumbnail for version as of 16:42, 20 April 2009

td.span: (Fixed "No Character encoding declared at document level")

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 06:36, 25 November 2008
Thumbnail for version as of 15:18, 16 September 2007

td.span: (trying to get image to display at all pixel sizes)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 20:41, 29 March 2006
Thumbnail for version as of 04:33, 29 March 2006
Thumbnail for version as of 01:08, 23 March 2006
Thumbnail for version as of 05:24, 21 March 2006

td.span: ("…arms of equal length are a sixth longer than their width…", not 6:5 but 7:6! dimensions set to 600×600, same colors, less bytes)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 19:38, 1 February 2006

td.span: (switch to Pantone corresponder, as per talk)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 05:59, 30 January 2006
Thumbnail for version as of 13:34, 20 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 23:23, 17 December 2005

td.span: (cleanup markup (don't seem to grasp the concept of cloning yet, s'pose I should look it up))

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 07:18, 16 December 2005

td.span: (I cloned the cross, no other changes.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 12:00, 2 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 11:56, 2 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 11:55, 2 December 2005

td.span: (it doesn't, and it's clear you haven't researched this at all)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 11:47, 2 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 11:31, 2 December 2005

td.span: (rv to previous version with proper cross dimensions)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 10:49, 2 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 00:06, 2 December 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 01:32, 15 October 2005
Thumbnail for version as of 00:10, 15 October 2005

td.span: (The Swiss Consul in Los Angeles, California sent me a package containing information about the flag. While they have not said anything about the color shades, I am going use R 246, G 0, B 39.)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 01:45, 12 October 2005

td.span: (I received an email from the Swiss Consul in Los Angeles, California, about how to make the flag. The said to make a 25x25 unit sqaure, make the white center sqaure 5x5 units, and each arm 5x6 units. I have fixed the flag according to this description. Do)

img.alt: Thumbnail for version as of 23:50, 9 October 2005

td.span: (The The national flag of Switzerland. I used http://www.vexilla-mundi.com/switserland.htm as my construction sheet and the red I used was Pantone 485. Category:SVG flags)
